bug.short_desc: [Viewers] ComboViewer#setSelection does't select element w/o equals override

long_desc.thetext:
I use a ComboViewer to show elements of a class that does not override Object#equals and #hashCode. Therefore I specified an IElementComparer via ComboViewer#setComparer to do the job.
My expectation was that the comparer would be used in setSelection to find the element to be selected. Apparently this is not the case. To me this looks like a bug, or is this behaviour desired?
The attached test case reproduces this behaviour.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153503 ***

bug.short_desc: Strange error message when group key refers to bad binding column name

long_desc.thetext:
Run attached report design. The following error is shown:
Group key "groupkey" in group 1 cannot depend on column bindings defined in the group lower than itself.
This is a strange error. Since the actual problem is that the table's binding column "groupkey" is defined to refer to another existing binding: row["bad"].
EXPECTED BEHAVIOR: The error message should clearly indicate that a non-existing binding is the cause of the failure.
Created an attachment (id=47738) Report Design
*** Bug 153526 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Add check for non-existing bindings before excuting query. Fix the bug.

bug.short_desc: Bogus error when bad data set column referenced in group key

long_desc.thetext:
Run attached report design. Its group key binding column, "groupkey", is defined to refer to a non-existing data set column: dataSetRow["bad"]. However the actual error seen when previewing the report in BIRT designer:
Table (id = 6): + A BIRT exception occurred: Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: TypeError: valueOf is not a function. Script source: null, line: 0, text: <compiled script>. See next exception for more information. Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: TypeError: valueOf is not a function. Script source: null, line: 0, text: <compiled script>
This error is completely irrelevant to the actual cause of the problem.
Created an attachment (id=47739) Report Design

In original grouping algorithm Dte creates a temporary computed column using JS expression for every group with interval. In some cases Rhino cant give clear error message for the error in this computed column. As Gary's suggestion a class GroupComputedColumn is added to replace the ComputedColumn with complex JS expression. The class is sub class of ComputedColumn and contains a Calculator which can do the work of JS expression. New algorithm can give exact error message and have better performance.

bug.short_desc: Cannot publish configuration to a directory with valid special char

long_desc.thetext:
OS: Windows XP with SP2 Language: English Build: epf-composer-1.0-M5-N20060809-1735-win32
Steps: Input valid output directory name with special characters on publish wizard interface, e.g. "#", "%", "!", an error message popup: IUPP0103E: The destination path cannot contain these characters: \ # * ? " < > | ! % /
Expected Result: These special chars "#", "%", "!" is valid directory name, and "\" is directory split char, both of them should be pass this valid check.
This is by desgin. Those special chars will cause problems for the resulting URLs when navigating them in the browsers. We deliberately put more restrictions on the publish path names.
Close bug as work as design.

bug.short_desc: "Check external hyperlinks" doesn't work during publish

Steps: Publish a configuration with "external hyperlink", check the published site, it has the "external hyperlinks" whether check/unckeck "Check external hyperlinks" box during publish wizard.

bug.short_desc: Cannot convert broken links to plain text

long_desc.thetext:
OS: Windows XP with SP2 Language: English Build: epf-composer-1.0-M5-N20060809-1735-win32
Steps: Publish a configuration with an "external hyperlink" which is broken, e.g. "http://com.google", makesure check the "Convert broken links to plain text" box in publish wizard, verify the published site, the broken links isn't converted.

bug.short_desc: [Manifest Editor] Editor opens on the wrong page

long_desc.thetext:
I was using the Plug-in Manifest editor on the MANIFEST.MF page and closed the editor when I was done.
I then did an Open Resource on plugin.xml and chose the plugin.xml file for the same plugin (a regular source project in the workspace) as the MANIFEST.MF that I was looking at previously. When the editor opened, it went back to the MANIFEST.MF page instead of the plugin.xml source or any other plugin.xml-related page.
*** Bug 158948 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Upping severity. This annoys me every time I want to fix a warning in a plugin.xml or a Manifest.mf.
See also bug 128236 (plugin manifest editors not shared).
Could this be considered in the M7 polish pass?

sure, but this is one of the 'damned if you do and damned if you don't' defects. With the 3-file-in-one-editor thing, the behavior is never going to please everyone.
How are you proposing we address it?
What happens when you click on a manifest.mf? what happens when you click on a plugin.xml? If you close the editor while you are on a Forms page, and you open it again, right now, you go back to the same page, do you want to go to the source page?

Yes, I always want to go to the source page for the file I opened, see bug 173624. For me, the manifest editors almost always open on the wrong page, even in cases I really want to use one of the forms pages.
My take is that opening on the source pages is the least confusing option. If you really want to open the editor on forms pages, then you should at least make sure that the shown forms page really corresponds to the opened file, e.g. if I doubleclick a manifest.mf, I never want to land on the Extension Points page.

Wassim, can you try this:
1) Store last visible page on the per input context 2) Open on the last page of the input context, not the last page when saving the editor.

Dejan, I am not sure what you mean by last page per input context.
let' say: 1. In a plug-in that has both manifest.mf and plugin.xml, I open on a plugin.xml. It goes to the Extensions page. Fine. 2. I switch to the Extension Points page just for fun. 3. I switch to the dependencies tab and close. What do I save here?

> 1. In a plug-in that has both manifest.mf and plugin.xml, I open on a > plugin.xml. It goes to the Extensions page. Fine. > 2. I switch to the Extension Points page just for fun. > 3. I switch to the dependencies tab and close. > What do I save here?
According to my previous suggestion, you should save 'Extension Points' page because Dependencies belong to a different input context (manifest.mf).
how do we keep track of that?

It would require more work. You whould need to add a field in InputContext (lastPageId). Whenever a new page is selected, you would need to get the input context that this page belongs to, and store the page in it. On close, you would need to store last page Id for each input context in the memento.
On open, you would need to get the input context for the initial editor input, load its stored last Id, and use it.

sure, but after all that work, Markus will still be unhappy because he wants the source page :)
I think we will have to reinstate that 'always open on source page' preference in addition to what you are suggesting.

Preference page is fine. However, in his case opening build.properties would initially open 'Build' page but after switching to build.properties source page, this choice will be stored. If he later opens plugin.xml and close it on the Extensions Page, opening build.properties will give him source right away, not 'Extensions'.
Essentially my proposal pays attention to the file you clicked on to open the editor. In your scenerio above and with the 'Use source page' preference only, you would get the following:
1. In a plug-in that has both manifest.mf and plugin.xml, I open on a plugin.xml. It goes to plugin.xml source page. 2. I switch to manifest.mf source page and close. 3. I open plugin.xml again.
With the preference page only, after 3. you will get manifest.mf (being the last page stored), not plugin.xml.

I understand. Note however that I said in comment 11:
"I think we will have to reinstate that 'always open on source page' preference IN ADDITION to what you are suggesting."
Neither approach seems sufficient on its own to please the world.
As for your build.properties example, most of it is not applicable here, since double-clicking on a build.properties does not open all three files due to editor-file extension binding limitations in the platform.

I don't want to get in between the clash of two titans; however, I think we should take care on not being *too* smart and automatically doing unexpected things from the non-power user's perspective. See Bug # 180396.

(In reply to comment #11) > sure, but after all that work, Markus will still be unhappy because he wants > the source page :)
I would already be happy (at least for 3.3) if comment 10 was implemented. If I understood that correctly, the approach assumes that each manifest editor page "belongs" to exactly one source file, and opening a source file shows the most recently used editor page for that source file.
Scenarios: - if I only ever close an editor on a source page, it will always reopen on that source page - close an editor on a forms page that belongs to the editor's source file => reopening the file will reopen on that forms page - close an editor on a page that does *not* belong to the editor's source file => reopening the file will reopen on the most recently used page that belongs to the opened file (forms or source page)
> I think we will have to reinstate that 'always open on source page' preference > in addition to what you are suggesting.
If the behavior becomes predictable as outlined above, I could even live without the 'always open on source page' preference ;-).

Cool.
We can't please the world, so at the very least, we can try to please Markus.

As an end user, the behavior I would expect is fairly straightforward. If I was on a forms page, I expect to be back on that same forms page when I reopen any of the 3 files. If I was on a source page, though, I expect to go to the source page of the file I'm opening right then.

If I > was on a forms page, I expect to be back on that same forms page when I reopen > any of the 3 files. If I was on a source page, though, I expect to go to the > source page of the file I'm opening right then.
Actually, this is not a bad simplification that would be easier to implement:
1) When saving, if the current page is a form page, store it. Otherwise, store the special key '__input_source_page__' or something. 2) On restore, check the stored page id. If it is the special key, open the source that matches the initial editor input. Othewise, simply switch to the stored page id.
Comment 17 would also be fine with me.

Before people change their minds again, we seem to have a concensus on comment 17.
Mike, could you please take a look?
Once this is resolved, we can close Markus' other bug about having a preference as WONTFIX. I hate preferences.
*** Bug 173624 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed. Patch released to HEAD.
Target: 3.3 M7 Patch: patch_153515_2007-04-12_16-27.txt
Thanks Mike. I verified that it works very nicely.

bug.short_desc: Allows oda.consumer.services.IPropertyProvider to throw exception

long_desc.thetext: The oda.consumer.services.IPropertyProvider interface method getDataSourceProperties method should allow its implementation to throw an OdaException if needed, instead of throwing a runtime exception. Throwing an OdaException would ensure that it gets caught and handled properly by an ODA consumer.
Changed interface method to include "throws OdaException": Properties getDataSourceProperties( Properties candidateProperties, Object appContext ) throws OdaException;
Verified and closed.

bug.short_desc: The DND of embeddedimage from lib explorer to outline view doesn'w work when the report in outline has used the lib

long_desc.thetext:
embedded image can be created by an other embedded image. If a report include a library, the embedded image in library can be referenced by the report embedded image. Please check the method: StructureFactory:: createEmbeddedImage( embedded image);
Make sure GUI call the correct API.

GUI currently uses: StructureFactory.EmbeddedImage newEmbeddedImageFrom( EmbeddedImageHandle baseImage, String name, ModuleHandle targetModule ), it basically is same with StructureFactory:: createEmbeddedImage( embedded image)
In addtion, if GUI changes to use createEmbeddedImage instead, the problem still exists, and it become worse, the embeddedimage cannot be drag and drop from lib explorer onto ouline view even the report doesn't includ the library. So I think the problem comes from model but not GUI.

Fixed. After the DND of embeddedimage from lib explorer to outline view, if the target report hasn't included the source library, the library will be included firstly, and then makes a copy of source embeddedimage and copys it into target report on outline view.

bug.short_desc: Float and decimal parameter's sort doesn't work properly.

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Float and decimal parameter's sort doesn't work properly.
Steps to reproduce: 1. New birt sample source and dataset from orderdetails 2. new a report parameter, float, list-box, import values from priceeach column 3. tick sort alphabetically 4. preview
Expected result: Values in list are sorted when preview
Actual result: Values are not sorted.
Engine needs to return the sorted list.
Created an attachment (id=47835) Screenshot
"sort alphabetically" is not "sort by value". "sort alphabetically" means "51.82" is bigger than "127.67". "sort by value" means "127.67" is bigger than "51.82".
cancel

bug.short_desc: Default value is set automatically after new a null value

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Default value is set automatically after new a null value
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a report parameter, string, list-box, tick allownull. 2. Click New button, input nothing and click OK
Expected result: No default value.
Actual result: Null value is set as default value automatically. my locale is chinese

The default value is null when it was not set. And it is also null when it was set to be null. Model's API getDefaultValue() returns now in both two cases. So GUI cannot differentiate them. Need model's support to fix this problem.
Anyway, this feature was never changed, why it's a regression?
Since GUI cannot differentiate between null and not set, this behavior is expected.
Close it.

bug.short_desc: Invalid parameter value will destroy report preview

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Invalid parameter value will destroy report preview
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a report parameter, float type 2. Insert a label 3. Drag the parameter to Layout. 4. Preview and input "abc" as parameter value and click OK.
Expected result: Error is reported and label content displays
Actual result: Error is reported and label is lost. One parameter error should not blocked the whole report preview.

Viewer does the validation for the parameter input value to convert the string to an Object then transfer the object to Engine. If the validation is wrong, there is exception throw out.
If we should support the behavior in the bug expetation: if the parameter has error, but other report part is rendered well, we need Engine support firstly.
If the validation has error, the parameter string will not be converted to an Object. Viewer will not throw the exception but transfer the string to Engine. Engine should have some logic to handle this case to render the report. I think there are some changes.
If Engine can support this, Viewer will do the change soon.
reopen it
Confirmed with Engine. The logic will be very confused and complex. So don't handle it.
cancel

bug.short_desc: [expressions] Dynamic property for PropertyTester

long_desc.thetext: Currently the testable properties for a Object is defined in org.eclipse.core.expressions.propertyTesters extension ponit. It is inconveniently while properties name is dynamic(such as xpath).If possible define properties in wildcard format.
moving to UI for comment

Yuejie, can you please provide an example. Core expression doesn't predefine any properties. In fact the extension point is there to specify the set of testable properties. For example:
<extension point="org.eclipse.core.expressions.propertyTesters"> <propertyTester id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.IResourceTester" type="org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource" namespace="org.eclipse.jdt.ui" properties="canDelete" class="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.internal.ResourceTester"> </propertyTester> </extension>
Defines a new property tester for IResource with the testable property canDelete.
If you want to make a property test dynamic the way to go is to pass arguments to the property to test. For example if the canDelete property has to be dynamic it can take a parameter and the test expression would look like:
<test property="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.canDelete" args="20"/>

(In reply to comment #2)
> If you want to make a property test dynamic the way to go is to pass arguments > to the property to test. For example if the canDelete property has to be > dynamic it can take a parameter and the test expression would look like: > > <test property="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.canDelete" args="20"/> > I just want to use xpath as properties names, but i forgot that the xpath can be an arg, thanks for your advise, let me set this bug invalid. Thank you.

bug.short_desc: OK button in parameter dialog is enabled without default value in combo-box

long_desc.thetext:

Steps to reproduce: 1. New a report parameter, combo-box. 2. Click New button, input abc as value, click OK 3. Set abc as default value and close Edit Parameter dialog. 4. New a data source and dataset 5. Edit the parameter, remove abc value and import values from dataset

As it stands we don't claim to support any other WSDLFactory other than the reference implementation that ships with the wsdl4j plugin. Due to the classloading behaviour of eclipse it's often possible to run into problems when using code that passes class names around and expects a different plugin to be able to instantiate a class for the name. I'm changing the severity from major-->enhancement to reflect this.
BTW... is there some reason why you want to use WSDLFactory.newInstance() instead of simply instantiating your class?
This bug 103504 seems similar. In any case, the org.wsdl4j plug-in is no more as of WTP 2.0. It has moved to Orbit www.eclipse.org/orbit and renamed javax.wsdl.

bug.short_desc: Format for datetime parameter uses different locale in designer and runtime

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Format for datetime parameter uses different locale in designer and runtime
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a report parameter, datetime, combo-box, add a value 2. Click Change, select Long Date and click OK. Display text changed to Long Date format with Chinese form. 3. Preview and see list in parameter dialog.
Expected result: Display text is same between designer and runtime
Actual result: In design time, I saw chinese form display text. In preview(runtime), I saw English form display text.
BTW, my machine's region is China and the locale I set in eclipse->Preference is English.

The display text should be formatted based on the client or user session's locale. It should not be using the server system locale. All calls to BIRT engine API should be using locale nutral format. So designer and Web view UI should convert user input and engine output parameters from a locale nutral format to the user session's locale format.

I don't think it's a bug. For designer, we use the eclipse/jvm locale, which is Chinese for this case. For viewer, it may use the local in the preference. And it's english for this case. Let viewer to confirm if the preference locale overwrite the default eclipse/jvm locale.
Agree to Wang Qiangsheng. When create URL, viewer will use the preference locale as default locale. User can change it in URL, if not set, and viewer will get local from client browser.
Viewer should use the preference locale which is set by User.

bug.short_desc: [Wizards] Description in wizard does not wrap

long_desc.thetext:
Build: 3.3 M1
Something happened at the Platform/UI level between 3.2 and 3.3M1 since the same PDE code now shows weird behaviour on M1.
1. Open the New plug-in project wizard. 2. Once you get to the templates page of the wizard, choose the 'Hello World' template, press Next.
Note how the description of the page does not wrap and the wizard becomes very wide.
When I run the same PDE code against 3.2, the description wraps nicely onto two lines.

This is much worse than I thought.
1. On the Extensions page of a plug-in editor that has a dependency on the UI plug-in, press Add...
2. In the list of extension points, select org.eclipse.ui.actionSets and on the bottom, select the Hello Word Template. Press Next.
The wizard now takes up the entire width of the screen.
Again, if I run my code against platform/ui from 3.2, the wizard appears just fine.
Branko has also seen examples in Update Manager where the wizards are now too big.
Off the top of my head, I wonder if it could be due to the fix for bug 50994. Are you using the new shortcut wizard action to open the wizard when experiencing the sizing problems?
It happens with/without the shortcut. Also scenario in comment 1 does not involve shortcuts.
The fix for Bug 19462 caused this problem.
I was recomputing the width, when I should only have been recomputing the height (for the progress bar) to fix bug 19462.
released in HEAD for build > 20060814
thanks Karice.

bug.short_desc: Undo doesn't work correctly in some case

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Undo doesn't work correctly in some case
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a report parameter. 2. New a data source 3. Edit paramter, select list-box, tick dynamic, click Create dataset button. 4. Create a dataset and click Finish 5. Back to paramter dialog, click Cancel. 6. Undo it.
Expected result: Created dataset is deleted.
Actual result: Data souce is deleted.

It is the right case that the data set created by editing parameter can not removed when click 'undo'.
When editing the parameter, GUI starts a persistent transaction to do the data set generation operations, so that the data set is added to the data set forever even if you cancel the editing parameter action. It is a meaningful use case. It is not a bug. There are some examples in the Eclipse, such as, click search button to find something, click 'choose' button to add a working set and finish, then cancel the 'search' action. The added working set is already added persistently even the 'search' is cancelled.
cancel this bug.

bug.short_desc: Trac connector: Implement generialized issue search

long_desc.thetext: Adapt query page to refactored query framework (bug 142783).

Created an attachment (id=47810) Generic search for Trac
If the last search was done in a Trac repository and the search dialog is reopened the Search button is disabled although scontainer.setPerformActionEnabled(true) is invoked in setVisible().
Applied patch and fixed above issue (scontainer.setPerformActionEnabled(true) was being overridden by RepositorySearchPage, my bad). Looking into changes you suggested on bug#142783 comment#11.

Great to see the integrated Trac search working!
There is an oustanding problem here: invoking the search for a common term (e.g. "ticket") causes non-stop flickering of the Task List, indicating a bug with notifiying the task list of changes during the search. Please investigate.

The implementation currently invokes TracRepositoryConnector.performQuery() which creates a task for each query hit. It does not invoke notifyLocalInfoChanged() though so I am not sure where the flickering comes from (it does not happen on my system).
The current implemenation will cause all query hits to show up in the archive category which is probably undesired anyways? I'll change TracQueryHit to create tasks on demand like BugzillaQueryHit does which should fix this.

Yes, that should fix it and is the correct behavior. For example, I recently noticed a test tasklist.xml bloat to from 100 to 600K when I accidentally made too comprehensive a query. We should also consider the Framework encapsulating the on-demand creation of tasks.
Could you please submit a patch for the failing Trac tests?

(In reply to comment #5) > Could you please submit a patch for the failing Trac tests?
I commited the fix as part of the attachment handler: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=151900#c10 .
Yes, there is a potential for a more generic implementation of the query result handling. I got started on that yesterday but I got stuck refactoring DelegatingTaskExternalizer which currently doesn't handle query results. I would like to move the implementation of BugzillaTaskExternalizer.readQueryHit() and readQueryHit() up to the abstract super class to avoid duplicating that code for Trac. Does that make sense?
Created an attachment (id=48552) create Trac tasks on demand
Created an attachment (id=48553) mylar/context/zip
Patch applied. Please mark resolved if this completes the task.
Fixed.

bug.short_desc: Use boolean param in cascading group will cause cascading fail

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Use boolean param in cascading group will cause cascading fail
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a birt data source and dataset from OFFICES. 2. Add a computed column, name is b_1, input expression like: if(row[0]%2==0) true; else false; 3. New cascading parameter, first parameter is from column b_1, type is boolean, second parameter is OFFICECODE. 4. Preview report, select true in first paramter list, see list for second parameter.

Actual result: Blank list for second parameter.
This bug is Model's bug, in its ParameterValidationUtil, it does not handle the case if the parameter datatype is boolean. It will always return Null vaule.

bug.short_desc: New Connection Wizard should open the RSE Perspective when done

long_desc.thetext:
The New Connection Wizard can be used even if the RSE Perspective is not open.
When the OK button is pressed in the wizard and thus a new connection is being created, the user should be offered the opportunity to switch to the RSE Perspective. Because this is the only way how the result of the operation (adding a new connection) can further be used. This is good practice with many other Eclipse actions as well (e.g. Team > Synchronize; Launch debugger; Capabilities).

It might be sufficient to add the "finalPerspective" attribute to the "org.eclipse.ui.newWizards" extension point. Docu says:
# finalPerspective - an optional attribute which identifies a perspective to activate when IProject resource creation is finished.
Hmm, the finalPerspective field alone doesnt do the trick. Not sure what's needed to bring up the perspective switch dialog.

From my experience with the perspective switches from the launch configurations area, the wizard will need to trigger it explicitly. As we are not creating any IResource derived object, the internal Eclipse mechanism is most likely not triggered.
However, that behavior is extremly dangerous and we definitly should re-think if we really want this. If at all, this must be configurable per system type! Each system type provider will have a different opinion in which perspective it should be switched.
We (Wind River) alone have 3 different perspective possiblities combined by a complex matrix if system types auto-attach to debuggers or are JTAG connections or ... or ... or .... There are enough problems with switching into wrong perspective at the wrong time as the Eclipse perspective switch mechanism is not context specific enough.
Very good points. Removing from 2.0 plan to consider later.

bug.short_desc: org.aspectj Restructure - Phase 1.1: ASM (Object Web) Bundle

long_desc.thetext:
ASM is optional but to make it truly pluggable it should be packaged as separate fragment to the weaver bundle. This ensures we do not introduce dependencies in the mainline and can easily subset the product for both build and testing. I have identified a few tasks:
1. Create og.aspectj.weaver.asm 2. Move asm-aj.jar 3. Move org.aspectj.weaver.asm 4. Move org.aspectj.weaver.tools.IsAtAspectJAnnotation 5. Possibly move AsmDelegateTests to new org.aspectj.weaver.asm to new org.aspectj.weaver.asm.tests 6. Fix WeavingAdaptor which as of Bug 152873 Optimize shouldWeaveAnnotationStyleAspect with Patch has build-time dependency on ASM. 7. Fix BcelWeaver by introducing a TypeDelegateFactory (ASM/BCEL) which is determined at construction.
Part of the proposed solution to Bug 113948.

bug.short_desc: [reorg] [dcr] Provide extension point for custom pasters into the Package Explorer

long_desc.thetext:
version=3.3M1
I like the new ability to paste Java code into the package explorer and have a Java project created for it. It would be even nicer if this was extensible to allow similiar behaviour for other content types, such as AspectJ code to create an AspectJ project.
I had a quick look in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.refactoring.reorg.PasteAction and it seems there is a defined list of pasters set in createEnabledPasters(), so I would have thought this could be extended to add any pasters contributed via an extension point to the end of this list of pasters.

bug.short_desc: hide page break of a group in html

long_desc.thetext:
hi,
i want to hide the page break of a group if the report format is html and do the group page break if the report format is pdf.
best regards, mseele
ok, is a bad workaround: i got a last page only with the table header and little spacing between table header and group header on the other pages...
There is an engine task setting to ignore page break when output to HTML. please check out the BIRT viewer cod. It is used in the preview tab and view report as HTML.

ok, my workaround is HTMLRenderOption.setHtmlPagination(false);. this will avoid page breaks in html output.
but the possibility to control group page breaks through scripting will be also interesting. :-)
Consider support changing pagebreak properties in the onPrepare() scripting method of a group.
had been fixed. Format can be got in OnPrepare method

bug.short_desc: RCP/SWT application causes JVM crash under windows XP

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
We are running an RCP application under windows which uses SWT components .Intermittently the JVM crashes.I doubt SWT is the prime suspect or JVM???We are unable to identify the exact sequence in which the crash occurs.I'm attaching some hs_err_pdi* log files for the abnormal crash.
Any insight appreciated. rgds, tess
Created an attachment (id=47757) JVM core dump 1
Created an attachment (id=47758) JVM core dump 2
Created an attachment (id=47759) JVM core dump 3
Created an attachment (id=47760) JVM core dump 4
Created an attachment (id=47761) JVM core dump 5

Wow. The first crash is in the VM. Crashes 2-4 are in the operating system and crash 5 does not include a stack. This looks like memory trashing to me. Are you running any custom JNI code in your RCP appliation?

steve,
We are not using any custom JNI code.
As you can see in the dumps,sometimes the problem occurs when we try to close the application.
Ok, how about trying another VM? That would rule out JVM's and point the finger at SWT.
Created an attachment (id=50232) latest one - doubt perm size crash

Steve,
I came across some Eclipse3.2 bugs and gussed the problem might have been in perm size .The VM argument for perm memory is changed to 256 M.For a short while we didn't met with any problem.Recently,without the above said change application crashed again.Can you pls check the attached dump just to know that if it has got anything to do with the perm size .

Sorry but there's not much information in the crash. I'm willing to say that the perm size is the problem (if you are). There is no way to determine this from the crashes and the size of the perm space is beyond the control of SWT (other than to say that a design goal of SWT is to minimize the number of API classes that it defines).
Can we close this (and reopen if you get the crash with the perm size changes)?
ok Steve.You can close this out.Thanks very much
OK, we're blaming 'perm size'.

attachment.desc: latest one - doubt perm size crash

bug.short_desc: Please add ModelQueryExtension to the API

long_desc.thetext:
We are creating an editor for IP-XACT (SPIRIT - see http://www.spiritconsortium.org ) files. These are XML files using the IP-XACT schema, but with some additional semantic rules. By experiment I have found that we can customize content assist in the source view and attribute value choices in the tree view as we want using the ModelQueryExtension extension point and interface. This, however, is not an API extension point and interface, and there is no equivelent in the API. Please can you add this extension point and interface to the API of org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.
Note:- DSDP will, in future, be using IP-XACT to describe debug targets.

So, your end goal is to customize content assist, right?
Is your desire to replace it? Or, add to it?
Just wondering (its a common request).

Yes. My end goal is to customize content assist in all its forms (content assist pop-ups in the source window, pull downs in the XML design and properties windows.).
Typically I want to give content assist for attribute and element values the don't currently have any, because, for example, they are declared to be of type xs:Name. For examples:
A IP-XACT design file contains interconnection elements. The componentRef attributes within these must refer to component instances defined elsewhere in the design file (in componentInstance/name elements). I would like to configure content assist to dynamically give me a list of defined components.
The interconnection elements also contain busRef attributes. The values of these must match the names of bus interfaces defined within other IP-XACT files defining component types. If the appropriate file is available I would like to be able to prompt the user with possible bus interface names.
NOTE:- The relationship between componentRefs and componentInstance names is enforced though the schema by a key/keyref relationship, but content assist does not notice such relationships (and I can see it would be difficult to make it do so in general). The relationship between busRefs and bus interface names can not be enforced by the schema since the elements are in different XML files.
In future I can see that there might be cases where I would want to restrict existing content assist, particularly on the list of new elements that can be created, but also, conceivably, restricting enums to a subset of their values, but this is not my main aim for now.
The existing ModelQueryExtension interface at the moment fits my needs quite well, but I am concerned about using an interface that is not part of the API.

Thanks for the feedback Anthony. We've been trying to understand where the 'right' place to enable users to customize the 'guided editing' experience. So just to clarify the current state of the universe ... here's the options you have today (at least as I see it)...
1) provide your own ContentAssistProcessor
This is a fairly flexible approach and provide a lot of control at the source editor level. It's fully supported API (though there may still be work to do as described in bug 157234). The one gotcha here is that this API controls the behaviour of the source view's content assist and nothing else (e.g. menu actions, property sheet cell editors, etc.).
2) provide your own ModelQueryExtension
This approach provides some fairly limited control over 'guided editing' at the model level. Although limited, this approach is adequate for languages like XML Schema and WSDL that simply need to provide dynamic suggestions for attribute values and constrain 'wild card' suggestion behaviour. The benefit of using the approach is that it controls the behaviour of any 'grammar aware' user interface component (source view content assist, outline menu 'add' actions, property sheet cell editors, etc). Other drawbacks of this approach include the fact that you can't control the user interface presentation details (since it lives at the model level) ... and it's not API (as you've pointed out).

bug.short_desc: Error Message Not Shown when No Resources Are Selected For Import

long_desc.thetext:
Message stating "There are no resources currently selected for import" is not showing up after a Clear All of the selected resources has been performed in the Log Import Wizard.
Windows XP TPTP 4.2.1
Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select File > Import> Profiling and Logging > Log File > Next 2) Click on "Add" button 3) Select Apache HTTP Server Access Log 4) Click on Browse Button 5) Click on Browse button again in 'Import Log Sets' Window 6) Error Message is displayed : " There are no resources currently selected for import" 7) Browse to a directory and Select it 9) Select some resources 10) Click on Clear All button 11) Error Message is not shown at the top and OK button is enabled even though no resources are selected for import.
See patch for bugzilla 153487 which covers this defect as the two were dependent.
Patch reviewed and checked in.
Correcting target when this was resolved.

bug.short_desc: [modulecore] NullPointerException being thrown and caught in ComponentImplRegistryReader.createComponent() during normal execution.

long_desc.thetext:
ComponentImplRegistryReader.createComponent() routinely throws and swallows NullPointerExceptions if it is asked to create a component for a project that is not (yet) a faceted project - it is not checking the return value of ProjectFacetsManager.getProjectFacet() for null.
Not a blocker by any means as the NPE is swallowed but the code could be a little 'nicer' as it is disruptive when trying to debug NPEs elsewhere using Java Exception breakpoints...
Example stack trace:

bug.short_desc: Preferences filtering does not work for Mylar Preferences

long_desc.thetext:
steps to reproduce: open window -> Preferences type mylar in the filter box in the top left corner everything but the mylar main preference page is filtered away, even though there are sub preference pages which also have the term mylar in them
expected behaviour: all the preference pages having the word mylar in them should appear when filtering for mylar or even: all the preference pages in the category mylar should appear, which seems to be the behaviour for other preference pages

Created an attachment (id=47766) screenshot
demonstrating the lack of sub preference pages showing up
use case is that I would like to type in mylar in the filter box and then be able to set all the preferences concerning mylar.

Done. Turns out this is supported via the keyword mechanism:
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.preferencePages"> <page name="Resources" class="org.eclipse.mylar.internal.resources.ui.preferences.MylarResourcesPreferencePage" id="org.eclipse.mylar.ide.preferences.resources" category="org.eclipse.mylar.ui.preferences"> <keywordReference id="org.eclipse.mylar.ide.keywords"/> </page> </extension>
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.keywords"> <keyword label="mylar resources" id="org.eclipse.mylar.ide.keywords"/> </extension>

this is how I would want it to look like. when entering java. the java preferences including the sub preference pages are still shown.
same problem still exists as in original comment. see above screenshots

So I assume that you somehow managed to get both versions > running at the same time? Any clues as to how that might have happened? >

bug.short_desc: [Help] ECLIPSE_HOME parameter for Eclipse InfoCenter

long_desc.thetext:
Back in Eclipse 2.0.2, there used to be an Eclipse.java class in plugins\org.eclipse.help.webapp_2.0.2\WEB-INF\lib which would lookup a ECLIPSE_HOME init parameter. It is through this variable that we can specify where the Eclipse home is install. However this does not seem to be the case in Eclipse 3.2.
How do I specify the Eclipse home path in the 3.2 version of the InfoCenter so it can locate all the needed jars at runtime?

See: http://help.eclipse.org/help32/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/guide/ua_help_setup_infocenter.htm
When launching, use the -eclipsehome variable.

I understand that the -eclipsehome variable is used when launching the Eclipse InfoCenter as a standalone using the stripped down version of Tomcat server that comes with Eclipse.
However, I'm trying to run the InfoCenter on WebSphere Application Server 6.0. I was able to successfully run the older Eclipse 2.0.2 InfoCenter since the ECLIPSE_HOME init parameter was used. Now the design seems to be changed and the Eclipse.java is no longer used.
In which class do you look up the -eclipsehome variable?
Thanks for the information :)

Created an attachment (id=47768) Test Case for the @Configurable problem
Just execute set the SPRING Eclipse variable to the Spring RC3 distribution and start ConfigurableTest unit test with the -javaagent argument and it fails

The offending code has changed in the 1.5.3 development branch. Looking back at the V1_5_2_final tagged version, this NPE must have been caused by someone passing null into ClassLoaderRepository constructor.
L183 is the corresponding line in the current version.

This is almost certainly triggered by the change to use ReflectionDelegates during load time weaving. We know go to the Java15ReflectionBasedReferenceTypeDelegate and ask for annotation types :- the Java15AnnotationFinder has not been properly initialized at this point and does not have a classloader set. It's all downhill from there...

I think it's a bug in ClassLoaderRepositor: it should allow for loading from the bootstrap loader with null. So when the annotation finder gets set to have a null loader for the bootstrap and it makes a new repository for null, that should be *valid*.

The problem comes from Java15ReflectionBasedReferenceTypeDelegate L66 that creates an annotation finder to use based on the classloader passed in. LTWWorld L108 passes in "null" for the classloader parameter, and this is the cause of the problem.
Changing the code here to pass in ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader instead makes the test pass. I'm running the full suite now. Can you think of any adverse side-effects that passing this classloader in here would have?
This is a serious issue for Spring as it breaks LTW with annotation matching on classes (i.e. @Configurable support).

Yes this isn't correct semantics. ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader returns the application loader but these are types loaded from the bootstrap loader, i.e., null. My suggestion for fixing the issue in the ClassLoaderRepository to handle bootstrap loaders won't return annotations defined on the classpath that aren't visible to the bootstrap loader.

Created an attachment (id=47784) Patch to ClassLoaderRepository in HEAD to handle bootstrap loader correctly
This needs to be tested. Of course we should add a simple LTW test case that exercises the annotation finder to test any solution to this problem.

I guess it *could* find annotations on boot classes that aren't in the boot classpath - unlikely... but the new URLClassLoader(new URL[0]) trick you suggest is better.
The ReflectionTypeDelegate doesn't only use the passed in classloader for annotation finding, it's also used for finding declared pointcuts too. I think it's better if this field is never null in a reflection delegate, so I'm going to initialize the delegate classloader to a boot classloader (constructed as above) if null is passed in. We could patch ClassLoaderRepository too for a belt-and-braces approach.
Given that 1.5.3 is probably not until end of September, and the seriousness of this issue, we may have to put out a 1.5.2a (I hate those...) containing this fix on the 1.5.2 tagged source. The pipelining stuff in 1.5.3 needs more time to bed down before we put a release out with that in, so I don't want to go from HEAD for a full release.
We definitely need to add some tests to the suite as part of this bug fix so that we don't let this one slip through the net again...

fix committed in HEAD (1.5.3 release stream). I've also created branch RB_V_1_5_2 from the 1.5.2_final tag, and am adding just this one fix to it. I'll then tag that tree as 1_5_2a and upload the file to the AspectJ downloads page.

I'd suggest one small change: it's confusing to have the variable in ReflectionBasedReferenceTypeDelegate be named BootClassLoader with a capital B: it makes you think there's a new type involved at a glance. I'd suggest renaming to bootClassLoader.
*** Bug 158179 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

attachment.desc: Patch to ClassLoaderRepository in HEAD to handle bootstrap loader correctly

bug.short_desc: support filtering top level task list elements, e.g. via working sets

long_desc.thetext:
I would like to organize my query tasks within a set of nested categories.
For example:
Milestone Items >>M1 >>>>Platform Items >>>>JDT Items >>M2
Can't you just create several queries?
There are several queries but I like to have a cleaner top level organization to the task list.
There is a discussion related to subtasks (which will probably bare on sub categories) on bug#137543.

Another use case is to make categories map to roles, e.g. "My tasks", "Products I'm watching", "People I'm watching". This would enable you to work by "going into" the "My tasks" category when working, and then go up to the root when you want to catch up. The problem right now is that it can be easy for the task list to get overloaded with incoming messages. But we have to tread carefully here because there is an overlap with organizing this information via subtasks (a la Microsoft Project) vs. organizing it with nested categories. One way to think about the split is that the subtask attributes comes from the repository (e.g. via milestones, or bug dependendcies as is a convention for Bugzilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=330700). The query set up and categorization structure is your own personal view, and you might want the ability nest queries in categories.
I'm marking this to be looked at for 0.7 since we need to figure out our task/category hierarchy story in time for 1.0.

We discussed the need for this feature on a recent conference call, and came up with a potential solution that integrates nicely with Eclipse without complicating the UI with arbitrary nesting of categories: allowing the top level elements in the Task List to be working sets. This is going to have to wait post 1.0, and we need to keep subtasks (bug 137543) in mind when designing this UI. Marking P2 to raise the priority for this in post-1.0 planning.

*** Bug 163480 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 180250 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

It is also possible to create a "dynamic" working sets that could use scheduling rules to show or hide certain elements in the Task List.
For example, let's say Mik have a "home" query (he actually does), so he may not want to see changes in that query (even if it has tasks scheduled for today) while he is working on some other things. So, he can specify a working set and set time intervals when those tasks will be visible (i.e. early morning, lunch time and at the end of the day)...

bug.short_desc: Track changes from applying a patch

long_desc.thetext: When I activate a task and then apply a team patch I do not see the changed contents when I appy mylar settings. I need to physically open the files in an editor before mylar starts to track the content changes.

The problem is that Mylar considers all files not modified by you to be indirectly interesting, whereas files that you select and edit are directly interesting. Directly interesting elements show in filtered views like the Package Explorer, whereas indirectly interesting things are only used for operations such as change set management (so these files do get put into the active change set).
On the Mylar project we work around this by asking that a context be attached with each patch that's submitted. But that's not realistic for all projects. So we should add support for this, although this will require some work because interaction monitoring is currently stateless (i.e. when resources change we don't know if it is as a result of a patch being applied or a refactoring completion).
An easy alternative is to provie a "Mark interesting" action in the Synchronize view that would allow you to click a Change Set node or anything below it, and would have the effect of making everything contained within that node interesting (i.e. show up in the Pacakge Exploer). Thoughts?
By the way, can't we just parse patches attached to issue and reconstruct context based on the content of the patch?...

If you mean to get the Java element contents, yes, I think that's a better approach overall. but would be more work since the Apply Patch wizard is very closed (package private classes). Also, it would be a language-specific solution, an we would still want a generic solution.
So maybe the right approach for now is to parse the patch for all changed files instead of relying on resource modifications. I'm not sure if we'll have a reasonable way to know when the Apply Patch wizard has finished, but could look into that.

(In reply to comment #3) > So maybe the right approach for now is to parse the patch for all changed files > instead of relying on resource modifications.
That is what I meant. This should be quite portable because of the unified diff format.
BTW, I've been trying to pull attached conttexts several times and found their quality quite bad. E.g. you can try to get context of that spellchecking issue that Rob completed... I believe got more context just looking at the patch.

By the context quality, do you mean that you'll see a bunch of folders without files in them? That's what I've noticed in a few cases, and will be resolved with bug 118542 and related context model improvements that are scheduled for 0.7/1.0.

(In reply to comment #5) > By the context quality, do you mean that you'll see a bunch of folders without > files in them? That's what I've noticed in a few cases, and will be resolved > with bug 118542 and related context model improvements that are scheduled for > 0.7/1.0.
I guess not only that, but also context had none or just one relevant resource unfiltered in package explorer after I activated it.

Current work-around is to attach context with the patches. In the event that is not possible, the manual work-around is to select Open via the Synchronize view's context menu in order to manually populate the task context.

- TOCGETTINGSTARTED.XML - The <topic label="Projects"> tag is not closed. - The current code is: <toc label="Getting Started" ... > <topic label="System Requirements" ... ></topic> <topic label="Preparing the Workbench" ... ></topic> . . . <topic label="Projects" > <topic label="Creating a Project" ... ></topic> <topic label="Browsing and Navigating" ... ></topic> . . . </toc> - There is a fix suggestion: <toc label="Getting Started" ... > <topic label="System Requirements" ... ></topic> <topic label="Preparing the Workbench" ... ></topic> . . . <topic label="Projects" > <topic label="Creating a Project" ... ></topic> <topic label="Browsing and Navigating" ... ></topic> . . . </topic> </toc>

thx

So what you are saying is that preference is actually in there for no reason at all and the fact that it had worked in previous releases was purely a mistake?

bug.short_desc: [Viewers] TreeNode should look at parent for equals and hashCode

long_desc.thetext:
The org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeNode class should incorporate it's parent into the equals and hashCode methods. Other useful changes:
- toString() should invoke value.toString() - an assert on the value not being null in the constructor - fields protected access instead of private - copy constructor - setChildren using varargs (but this could break JDK 1.4 comp?)
Also, no JFace component exists when reporting bugs.

Platform/UI is the correct component for filing JFace bugs.
Could you please explain why a node's parent should be used in the equals and hashCode methods? Thanks.

The default comparer uses String comparison when constructing the TreeNode object with a String. 2 child nodes are easily named the same in many use cases, and therefore, the equals method of the parent (and the parent parents) needs to be taken into account when checking for 'equal objects'.
And even looking from a non-String perspective, the equals method of any 'node' object should incorporate checks to the parent, since 2 nodes can have the same value but a different parent, but the nodes are not equal since their parent differs.

bug.short_desc: selection tools marquees don't draw correctly in OS X

long_desc.thetext:
The selection tools (and subtypes) don't draw a marquee correctly. The marquee uses white and transparent so on a white background you cannot see the bounds of the drag rectangle. This is evident on the Shapes sample.
The correct behaviour would be some sort XOR type drawing, so no matter the color in the background, the selection rectangle would be visible.
We are using XOR, the problem is that Mac OS X doesn't support it.

You may want to look at carbon sketch and implement the specific selection drawing as necessary for the platform. They implement 'marching ants' in that application.
<http://developer.apple.com/documentation/Carbon/Conceptual/QuickDrawToQuartz2D/tq_regions/chapter_8_section_3.html>
If the marching ants is not the correct ui guideline, then color the rectangle, or anything to indicate the bounds of the drag.

long_desc.thetext: Recent changes made to ElementSelectionComposite.handleFilterChange(..) have resulted in changes made to the input, element selection scope to be ignored. search is relaunched only if the pattern is changed. While that check is valid, search needs to be redone if the scope of the input has been changed.

Created an attachment (id=47774) The test invocations shown under my test execution do not have a name.

To avoid dup the name of the test should only be added (inside braces) if it exists and if it is not equal to the execution result one. This is can be seen for JUnit test (using test behavior as code).

bug.short_desc: [j2ee] J2EE Module dependencies having issues

long_desc.thetext: I have an EAR project containing a binary ejb jar and a utility jar. Also in the same workspace, a web project and a Java project with an external jar. The jars in the EAR are included in the web project under the J2EE modules tab. When I try to add the jar in the java project using the "Add Jar..." option on the web project, entries for the ear jars get created in the component file in the web project, resulting in duplicate build path entries error.

It turns out this defect is much more general. The problem is in the WebLibs preference page, they way the new web lib references are added grabs all existing references (including dynamic references) and stores them in a temp list before appending the new references; then the entire list is set. The fix is to only add the real new references.

Created an attachment (id=47776) patch
In addition to the fix described above I hit a IndexOutOfBoundsException which is clearly the result of a coding error (iterating over j but using i).
Approve.
Approve
approve
(wrong window for approve above) code dropped.
closing

bug.short_desc: [Viewers] ITableColorProvider methods should include an int rowIndex argument

long_desc.thetext:
ITableColorProvider methods should include an int rowIndex argument, e.g.:
Color getForeground(Object element, int columnIndex)
should become:
Color getForeground(Object element, int rowIndex, int columnIndex)
This would be useful for implementing alternating row colors.
You should also create an ITreeColorProvider that has signatures such as the following:
Color getForeground(Object element, int[] rowIndices, int columnIndex)
The difference is that rowIndices would contain as many int elements as the row is deep in the tree, and each int element would be the rowIndex of the item or its ancestor at that level. e.g.:
Tree diagram:
A -+- 1 | +- 2 -+- a
B -+- 3 -+- b | +- c
Results in the following zero-based rowIndices arguments for the respective rows:
A: {0} B: {1} 1: {0, 0} 2: {0, 1} 3: {1, 0} a: {0, 1, 0} b: {1, 0, 0} c: {1, 0, 1}
This would be helpful for varying colors depending on depth, and alternating colors at the same depth.
Thank you,
Ross
PS: I marked this as an SWT component bug since JFace was no listed.

(In reply to comment #0) > ITableColorProvider methods should include an int rowIndex argument, e.g.: > > Color getForeground(Object element, int columnIndex) > > should become: > > Color getForeground(Object element, int rowIndex, int columnIndex)
That's not possible because the SWT-Tree doesn't support to find the current row the item is drawn in. I for myself don't think that JFace should provide such a function because the performance impact to calculate would be very high. But you could do this your own. If you convince the SWT-Team to provide a function which can be called to fetch the Row-Index I think JFace could maybe provide what you want.
> > This would be useful for implementing alternating row colors. > > You should also create an ITreeColorProvider that has signatures such as the > following: > > Color getForeground(Object element, int[] rowIndices, int columnIndex) > > The difference is that rowIndices would contain as many int elements as the row > is deep in the tree, and each int element would be the rowIndex of the item or > its ancestor at that level. e.g.: >
That's also impossible because of the thing mentionned above.
> Tree diagram: > > A -+- 1 > | > +- 2 -+- a > > B -+- 3 -+- b > | > +- c > > Results in the following zero-based rowIndices arguments for the respective > rows: > > A: {0} > B: {1} > 1: {0, 0} > 2: {0, 1} > 3: {1, 0} > a: {0, 1, 0} > b: {1, 0, 0} > c: {1, 0, 1} > > This would be helpful for varying colors depending on depth, and alternating > colors at the same depth. > > Thank you, > > Ross > > PS: I marked this as an SWT component bug since JFace was no listed. >
JFace is part of UI and you should log all bug belonging against JFace-Viewers by prefixing with [Viewers].
At last an idea how to find out if an item is drawn as odd/even row is to use its bounds method and calculate it. To keep your table consitent you have to recolor the whole tree if a tree-node is collapsed/expanded!

(In reply to comment #1) > (In reply to comment #0) > > ITableColorProvider methods should include an int rowIndex argument, e.g.: > > > > Color getForeground(Object element, int columnIndex) > > > > should become: > > > > Color getForeground(Object element, int rowIndex, int columnIndex) > > That's not possible because the SWT-Tree doesn't support to find the current > row the item is drawn in. I for myself don't think that JFace should provide > such a function because the performance impact to calculate would be very high. > But you could do this your own. If you convince the SWT-Team to provide a > function which can be called to fetch the Row-Index I think JFace could maybe > provide what you want.
(I'm just commenting on the TableViewer request)
SWT does provide a way to find the index of items in the form of Table#indexOf(TableItem) and StructuredViewer provides findItem(Object) which will return the Widget for the element, so that part is possible but efficiency would be a concern. But if you look in TableViewer when items are created (createItem(Object element, int index)) the index is available but it doesn't go any farther. Basically I think indexes would be available internally with a little work.
It's a common request to provide zebra striping for rows in Tables and as much as I'd like for everyone to convert to OS X so that they get this for free I doubt that will happen. Even if the proposed API isn't possible or isn't ideal hopefully we can take from this that zebra striping is a common request. It would be great if JFace provided some hook that allowed us to style rows in this fashion and to do so in an efficient manner.
In saying that the proposed API on its own wouldn't satisfy this need as any time an item is added/removed all subsequent items (after sort) would need to be updated which would mean the consumer would have to refresh the entire Table with the current API. To remedy this we would need an API to update an item and to update all subsequent sorted items.

We usually don't compensate for missing features of a given OS or window system. Linux/GTK or Mac OS uses zebra striping, and Windows doesn't. This is by design - for example if Windows Vista decided to use zebra striping by default, you would get it by default.
That said, we are working on a way to allow clients to use SWT's new owner draw together with a JFace viewer. You should be able to use this for implementing zebra striping. See bug 149193.

Created an attachment (id=49247) another crash log
Similar problem with another application : my application opens plugins too, when I open a certain editor for the second time, it crashes while calling the constructor of a Text widget.
'another crash log' seems unrelated. The crash is in the text window proc, not the table window proc.
I have no idea about this one. The recursion seems to be coming from CreateWindowEx() which is very early in the process. What kind of table is being created? Does the crash happen every time?

Created an attachment (id=50459) similar crash log while resizing table columns
This problem seems related. In my Editor I use a form with a table. The table has a control adapter attached which automatically resizes columns on table resize (Snippet77).
It reliably crashes Eclipse when maximizing the main window (or restoring from maximized to usual size) and the table is visible. This did not appear in Eclipse 3.1 Using Eclipse 3.2 under Windows XP, Java 1.4.2_02

Ok, the 'similar crash ' is happening because you are resizing table columns withing a resize handler. When you resize a column, this can cause the scroll bars to hide and show, which causes a resize handler, which can case the scroll bars to hide and show, which ... etc. Please enter a new bug report with a stand alone snippet that causes the crash (you could start with Snippet77).
This bug is tracking the bizarre crash coming from CreateWindowEx(). I have changed the title to reflect this.
Please reopen this if you see it again. We have made changes to the way we load the XP manifest file and this may be fixed as a result.
closed

attachment.desc: similar crash log while resizing table columns

bug.short_desc: Memory is not freed after SDB import

long_desc.thetext:
Build where problem found: TPTP-4.2.1-200608041327
JRE: Latest IBM, Windows / IA32 - 5.0 Service Release 2 (Windows / IA32) (pwi32dev-20060511) (J9)
1) Start eclipse with -Xmx500m 2) Enable Heap Status in preferences 3) Import SDB, use all the defaults in the SDB import wizard, except change "Import using" to IBM format 4) Click finish 5) When the import finishes, click on the garbage collection icon in the heap status several times
Final heap usage:
TPTP 4.2.0.1 - 73M TPTP 4.2.1 - 454M
TPTP 4.2.1 does not appear to be freeing up objects correctly.
This is causing a downstream IBM component to fail because there is no more memory for additional processing.
Alex, would you please take a look at the problem.

I was able to reproduce this problem with Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20060511 (SR2))
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows 2000 x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20060 504 (JIT enabled) J9VM - 20060501_06428_lHdSMR JIT - 20060428_1800_r8 GC - 20060501_AA) JCL - 20060511a
I have analyzed the memory heap dump after the editor was closed and concluded that an java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is keeping a heap of object including the SymptomCatalogImpl object in memory. Strange is that no OutOfMemoryError is encountered by the workbench. This problem is not reproducible with Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2) Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn142sr1a-20050209 (JIT enabled: jitc))
and
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_07-b03) Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_07-b03, mixed mode, sharing).
Running the JVM with disabled jit is not changing the outcome.
Recommending this as a candidate for 4.2.1

To workaround this problem a new instance of a symptom engine needs to be created at each import instead of reading it from the SymptomEditorDetailsFactory extension registered via the org.eclipse.hyades.sdb\schema\symptomEditHandler.exsd extension point. When using the code version that uses the extension point to read the symptom engine, the heap dump analysis reveals that the SymptomCatalogImpl object is kept in memory by a reference from the SymptomEngine which in turn is kept in memory by the SymptomEditorDetailsFactory extension which is referenced by the extension point reader and the references chain goes up via the osgi framework objects to an OutOfMemoryError, which is a root object according to the heap analyzer.

1) Explain why you believe this is a stop-ship defect. How does the defect manifest itself, and how will users of TPTP / consuming products be affected if the defect is not fixed? <apnan>Downstream products use IBM JDK 5 and the problem occurs when importing a WAS 4 symptom catalog using the proprietary format importer into a Symptom 2.0 format in the workbench. This is a common scenario when analyzing Websphere log files. After the first import about 400MB of memory are not released causing a serious memory leak. If the import is repeated the previous 400MB of memory are released but the leak is occurring again when the import finishes. 2) Is there a work-around? If so, why do you believe the work-around is insufficient? <apnan>The workaround is to shutdown the workbench and restart it, but this is not exactly what a user would want to do.
3) Is this a regression or API breakage? Explain. <apnan>It is a regression in 4.2.1 but only for IBM JDK 5.
4) Does this require new API? <apnan>No
5) Who performed the code review? <apnan>Myself and I also explained and shown the project lead the code snippet that solves the problem.
6) Is there a test case attached to the bugzilla record? <apnan>The standard Import symptom catalog into Symptom 2.0 format using the WAS importer would be sufficient, and we already have such a test case, but it would need to be executed using the IBM JDK 5.
7) What is the risk associated with this fix? <apnan> There is no risk associated, instead of reading the symptom edit handler from the extension point and then getting the symptom engine from the handler I am just creating a symptom engine object and setting it to the symptom catalog, exactly what the handler is actually doing. The only difference is that the handler is always returning the same instance while the SymptomLoader code would need to create a new instance at every WAS symptom catalog import. Since the Symptom engine object is lightweight and the import code is anyway creating a lot of objects it is of less significance.
8) Is this fix related to any standards that TPTP adheres to? If so, who has validated that the fix continues to adhere to the standard? <apnan>No
Fix checked in per PMC approval.
Verified with TPTP-4.2.1-200609010912.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: Does ComboViewer use IColorProvider in Eclipse 3.2?

long_desc.thetext:
Does ComboViewer use IColorProvider in Eclipse 3.2?
I have successfully used ITableColorProvider with both TableViewer & TreeViewer, but Eclipse does not seem to call the getForeground method of an IColorProvider-implementing LabelProvider that I used as the label provider for a ComboViewer.
If ComboViewer does not use IColorProvider, please update it so that it does.
Thanks,
Ross
PS: I did not post this in the newsgroups first because I cannot seem to login to the newsgroup web site and I do not have access to nntp.

org.eclipse.swt.Combo and org.eclipse.swt.List does not have an Item-Concept like Table/Tree have one (TableItem/TreeItem) so there could not be a color applied. There's nothing JFace could do until SWT doesn't provide such a feature.

(In reply to comment #1) > There's nothing JFace could do until SWT doesn't provide such a > feature.
Yes. Closing as LATER. Bug 28611 seems to be the one that asks for colored combo items in SWT.

bug.short_desc: [Navigation] Structure Compare. How to go to Next/Previous structural change

long_desc.thetext: This might just be an issue with the UI, but there doesn't seem to be a way once you have selected a structure difference area (a method usually) from the "Java Structure Compare" view, to then view and navigate the code looking only for those structural changes and not the source changes that can include all sort of format differences.
We're hoping to sort out navigation issues for 3.3.
There are two sets navigation buttons now. The first navigates diffs and the second navigates changes.
Verified

bug.short_desc: AspectJ compiler in Eclipse ignores "Includes/Excludes" in source path

long_desc.thetext: I have a project configured in Eclipse which fairly complex source structure when some parts of the source are preprocessed/generated and copied to tmp locations which are part of the source paths. In Eclipse I have configured the source paths using "include/exclude" capability. But AspectJ builder still finds two copies of some java files: one in source folder and other in tmp location and gives errors about "type is already defined". I have tried to clean the project. Switching AspectJ nature of the project off eliminates this problem, switching it back on gives it back.
Please could you attach your test project here. thanks
Created an attachment (id=47832) Test project

thanks, I've now reproduced the bug on both windows and linux. The bug occurs when B.java is the only included entry. If you start with everything included, and then exclude A.java, it works as expected.

Fix now available:
1.4.1.200608141223 for Eclipse 3.2 (build.169) 1.5.0.200608141300 for Eclipse 3.3M1 (build.4)

bug.short_desc: [modulecore] Class Cast exception prevents extended web type project creation

long_desc.thetext:
When trying to create an extended dynamic web type project in IBM, we get the following error which blocks project creation:
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Object incompatible with java.lang.String at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.util.ComponentUtilities.getServerContextRoot(ComponentUtilities.java:267) at
Created an attachment (id=47795) Proposed patch

Proposed patch is attached. It looks like the ordering on the check for the error was backwards. We should check for an error first, and if we have an error return null, otherwise, then check for a valid server context.
approve

Created an attachment (id=47852) Updated Patch with Dan's comments
Here is a new patch with Dan's suggestions incorporated.
This is released for the 081506 WTP 1.5.1 driver.
Verified 082806.
